intro: Rumicastrum stenogynum, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and are adapted to thrive in arid, sandy environments. Rumicastrum stenogynum is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
